title: Colours
text: palette sfthemes can sorted two ways. default order returns colors palette according appearance Apple’s HIG document, contrast (default) order returns optimized ordering colors maximize -contrast. iOS palette ordered -contrast  iOS palette ordered -contrast

title: Dynamic Light and Dark Plots in Web
text: , mentioned, need two versions plot, optimized light dark appearance, method delivering based user’s system preference.

title: Dynamic Light and Dark Plots in Web
text: shown , can produce two variants visualization using theme_sf_light() theme_sf_dark() themes, selected color scheme light dark mode.
code: library(ggplot2); library(sfthemes)  gp <- ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length,                  y = Sepal.Width,                  color = Species)) +         geom_point(aes(shape = Species)) +          xlab("Sepal Length") + ylab("Sepal Width") +         labs(title = "SF Light/Dark Themes",               subtitle = "iOS Light/Dark Color Palette") +         geom_smooth(method="lm", aes(fill = Species))  # Light gp + theme_sf_light(size_class = "xxxLarge") +         scale_colour_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         scale_fill_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom") ggsave("theme-sf-light.png")  # Dark gp + theme_sf_dark(size_class = "xxxLarge") +         scale_colour_ios_dark(accessible = FALSE) +         scale_fill_ios_dark(accessible = FALSE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom") ggsave("theme-sf-dark.png")

title: Dynamic Light and Dark Plots in Web
text: Now plots, can use HTML’s tags set different image based website’s appearance. example, code block makes sure theme-sf-dark.png source user seeing dark version website. Don’t alarmed use HTML, don’t necessarily need edit HTML files, fact, can just write inside markdown files. Markdown parsers smart enough detect piece HTML code, simply inject rendered HTML. instance, can see page generated using markdown file, using rmarkdown. figure created using snippet, change based preference.

title: Size Classes
text: using element_size_class parameter, can control scaling elements.
code: size_class <- "Medium"  gp <- ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length,                         y = Sepal.Width,                        color = Species)) +         geom_point(aes(shape = Species)) +          xlab("Sepal Length") + ylab("Sepal Width") +         labs(title = "SF Light/Dark Theme",               subtitle = paste0("Size Class: ", size_class) +         geom_smooth(method="lm", aes(fill = Species))  # Light gp + theme_sf_light(element_size_class = size_class) +         scale_colour_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         scale_fill_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom")  # Dark gp + theme_sf_dark(element_size_class = size_class) +         scale_colour_ios_dark(accessible = FALSE) +         scale_fill_ios_dark(accessible = FALSE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom")

title: Size Classes
text: using font_size_class parameter, can control scaling fonts.
code: size_class <- "Medium"  gp <- ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length,                         y = Sepal.Width,                        color = Species)) +         geom_point(aes(shape = Species)) +          xlab("Sepal Length") + ylab("Sepal Width") +         labs(title = "SF Light/Dark Theme",               subtitle = paste0("Size Class: ", size_class) +         geom_smooth(method="lm", aes(fill = Species))  # Light gp + theme_sf_light(font_size_class = size_class) +         scale_colour_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         scale_fill_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom")  # Dark gp + theme_sf_dark(font_size_class = size_class) +         scale_colour_ios_dark(accessible = FALSE) +         scale_fill_ios_dark(accessible = FALSE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom")

title: Size Classes
text: using size_class parameter, can control scaling elements, fonts. See readme code.

title: Typography
text: Inter free open source typeface, free use almost way imaginable. Inter closely related SF Pro. Like SF Pro, crafted designed computer screens, therefore sfthemes plots Inter fonts look lot like SF Pro variants. Inter vs SF Pro

title: Typography
text: Inter default typeface sfthemes, can used without setting special commands. However, interested using Inter themes, can use sf_set_inter function replace default font themes Inter. See documentation sf_set_inter() details.

title: Typography
text: San Francisco typeface consists three large family typefaces, SF Pro, SF Compact, SF Mono. designed used different Apple platforms, e.g., iOS, macOS. family characteristic optimized certain screen size resolution. sfthemes optimized SF Pro, general variant typeface designed iOS, iPadOS, macOS. Apple restricted usage entire SF typeface family developers designing developing applications material Apple’s platforms. Please keep restriction mind using sharing plots, using SF Pro main typeface plots. Moreover, distribution repackaging San Francisco family prohibited, therefore include font package. However, fonts can downloaded freely Apple’s website. Download SF Pro.

title: Typography
text: ⚠️ SF Pro yet fully implemented, ’m working fixing bugs making font available least macOS!

title: Typography
text: Besides Inter (SF Pro), sfthemes allows seamlessly patch entirety themes custom font. Read sf_set_custom_font() documentation.

title: Typography
text: sfthemes adjusted adapted available dynamic type sizes presented Apple’s HIG. sfthemes size classes based iOS font sizes minor compatibility modifications. total, 7 size classes available — .e., xSmall, Small, Medium, Large, xLarge, xxLarge, xxxLarge — Medium default class.

title: Typography
text: theme_sf_light() theme_sf_dark() accompanied scaling parameters, size_class, font_size_class, element_size_class. Setting either parameters aforementioned size classes scale elements desired class. detail can found size classes article.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Amir Masoud Abdol. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Abdol (2022). sfthemes: Accessible Set Themes Color Palettes Optimized Light/Dark Appearances, Different Screen Sizes. R package version 0.2.0, https://sfthemes.amirmasoudabdol.name.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sfthemes: An Accessible Set of Themes and Color Palettes Optimized for Light/Dark Appearances, and Different Screen Sizes},   author = {Amir Masoud Abdol},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://sfthemes.amirmasoudabdol.name}, }

title: San Francisco Themes
text: sfthemes pair ggplot2 themes, theme_sf_light(), theme_sf_dark(), collection color scales based Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines. Themes inspired occasional appearances charts used Apple within different contexts, e.g., Apple Health app, Screen Time iOS macOS. colors adapted iOS, macOS, watchOS system colors. color scale light dark variant well compliments light/dark themes, scale_colour_ios_light() scale_colour_ios_dark(), respectively. addition, sfthemes uses dynamic type sizing order provide consistent elegant overall resizing re-scaling plot elements. Read . combined, sfthemes offers unique opportunity generate two version plot two similar yet individually optimized color palettes light dark themes.

title: San Francisco Themes
text: Install development version GitHub ’m planning apply CRAN soon open! :P
code: install.packages("devtools"); library(devtools) devtools::install_github("amirmasoudabdol/sfthemes")

title: San Francisco Themes
text: can load configure sfthemes using following commands. get errors warnings, sfthemes fully configured can access required fonts. Important: ’m bit trouble automatically installing necessary fonts package. Therefore, highly recommend manually installing fonts system. import_inter function tries install fonts, print path containing font files manual installation.
code: library(ggplot2); library(sfthemes)  import_inter() # ← DO NOT FORGET THIS!

title: San Francisco Themes
text: sfthemes offers two base themes, theme_sf_light() theme_sf_dark(). Light theme uses -white background, #fafafa, range black colors text. contrast, dark theme uses -black background, #141414, range white colors text. addition themes, sfthemes provides set scale_colour/fill_* objects based various available color palettes Apple’s platforms. color palette light dark variant, well accessible form . Accessible color palettes adjusted higher contrast less brightness. list available color palettes can found .

title: San Francisco Themes
text: general, recommend pairing light scales light themes dark scales dark theme. use scale_colour_ios_light(), scale_colour_ios_dark() recreate figure . , sfthemes color scales optimized sfthemes themes, can mix match light dark themes ; however, need make sure visually work together.
code: library(ggplot2); library(sfthemes)  gp <- ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length,                  y = Sepal.Width,                  color = Species)) +         geom_point(aes(shape = Species)) +          xlab("Sepal Length") + ylab("Sepal Width") +         labs(title = "SF Light/Dark Themes",               subtitle = "iOS Light/Dark Color Palette") +         geom_smooth(method="lm", aes(fill = Species))  # Light gp + theme_sf_light(size_class = "xxxLarge") +         scale_colour_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         scale_fill_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom")  # Dark gp + theme_sf_dark(size_class = "xxxLarge") +         scale_colour_ios_dark(accessible = FALSE) +         scale_fill_ios_dark(accessible = FALSE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom")

title: San Francisco Themes
text: color palette accompanied accessible variant . order access accessible color palettes, can use accessible parameter follow. Colors article elaborates availability, differences, features system color palette.
code: iris.sum <- iris %>%     group_by(Species) %>%     summarize(PW.mean = mean(Petal.Width),                 PW.sd = sd(Petal.Width))  gp <- ggplot(iris.sum, aes(x = Species)) +         geom_bar(aes(y = PW.mean, fill = Species, color = Species),                   position = "dodge", stat = "identity") +         geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = PW.mean - PW.sd, ymax = PW.mean + PW.sd),                       position = position_dodge(width = 0.5),                       width = 0.5,                        color = "black") + # ← or "white" in dark theme         labs(title = "SF Light Theme",              subtitle = "iOS Light Color Palette - Normal vs. Accessible",               y = "Mean Petal Width", x = "Species")  # Normal gp + theme_sf_light(size_class = "xxxLarge") +         scale_colour_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         scale_fill_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom")  # Accessible gp + theme_sf_light(size_class = "xxxLarge") +         scale_colour_ios_light(accessible = TRUE) +         scale_fill_ios_light(accessible = TRUE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom")

title: San Francisco Themes
text: sfthemes provides 7 size classes, ie., scaling factors. Size classes can applied texts, elements, . example generated combination light/dark plots showcases available size classes. Size Classes article elaborates dynamic type sizing.
code: size_class <- "Medium" # ← You can modify the size class here  gp <- ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length,                  y = Sepal.Width,                  color = Species)) +         geom_point(aes(shape = Species)) +          xlab("Sepal Length") + ylab("Sepal Width") +         labs(title = "SF Light/Dark Theme",               subtitle = paste0("Size Class: ", size_class) +         geom_smooth(method="lm", aes(fill = Species))  # Light gp + theme_sf_light(size_class = size_class) + # ← Setting the size class         scale_colour_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         scale_fill_ios_light(accessible = FALSE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom")  # Dark gp + theme_sf_dark(size_class = size_class) + # ← Setting the size class         scale_colour_ios_dark(accessible = FALSE) +         scale_fill_ios_dark(accessible = FALSE) +         theme(legend.position = "bottom")

title: San Francisco Themes
text: goal sfthemes provide pair minimal accessible light dark themes. Moreover, sfthemes focuses bringing Apple’s system colors ggplot2, form color fill scales. Lastly, sfthemes tries incorporate modern typographical advancement theme’s structure aesthetic order guarantee elegant visualization different screen resolutions sizes.

title: San Francisco Themes
text: mainly focus keeping sfthemes functional, short list features like implement, find times. Adding three spacing classes control spacing margins plots elements. Adding SF Pro themes, using different variants optimal readability different size classes

title: Import Fonts — import_inter
text: handy functions facilitating process importing installing custom fonts available sfthemes.

title: Import Fonts — import_inter
code: import_inter()

title: Import Fonts — import_inter
text: sfthemes package includes 8 faces Inter typeface: Regular, Italic, Bold, Bold Italic, Light, Light Italic, Extra Bold, Extra Bold Italic. import_inter function makes sure fonts correctly installed can accessed R.

title: Import Fonts — import_inter
text: Make sure run command installing sfthemes, otherwise, encounter warning messages regarding missing font. Alternatively, can download install fonts manually.

title: iOS Color Palettes — ios_light_pal
text: Set color palettes based iOS System Colors. General information palette can found colors vignette.

title: iOS Color Palettes — ios_light_pal
code: ios_light_pal(order = "contrast", accessible = FALSE)  ios_dark_pal(order = "contrast", accessible = FALSE)  ios_gray_light_pal(accessible = FALSE)  ios_gray_dark_pal(accessible = FALSE)

title: iOS Color Palettes — ios_light_pal
text: order Indicates order colors palette accessible Indicates whether accessible set colors used

title: iOS Color Palettes — ios_light_pal
text: functions ideal accessing raw color values, can used within functions raw color values needed, e.g., plot. order use ggplot functions, must utilize one followings: scale_colour_ios_light scale_colour_ios_dark scale_colour_ios_gray_light scale_colour_ios_gray_dark

title: iOS Color Palettes — ios_light_pal
code: library(scales) scales::show_col(     ios_light_pal(order = "default", accessible = FALSE)(9),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)  scales::show_col(     ios_light_pal(order = "default", accessible = TRUE)(9),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)   scales::show_col(     ios_light_pal(order = "contrast", accessible = FALSE)(9),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)  scales::show_col(     ios_light_pal(order = "contrast", accessible = TRUE)(9),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)   library(scales) scales::show_col(     ios_dark_pal(order = "default", accessible = FALSE)(9),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)  scales::show_col(     ios_dark_pal(order = "default", accessible = TRUE)(9),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)   scales::show_col(     ios_dark_pal(order = "contrast", accessible = FALSE)(9),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)  scales::show_col(     ios_dark_pal(order = "contrast", accessible = TRUE)(9),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)   library(scales) scales::show_col(     ios_gray_light_pal(accessible = FALSE)(6),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)  scales::show_col(     ios_gray_light_pal(accessible = TRUE)(6),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)   library(scales) scales::show_col(     ios_gray_dark_pal(accessible = FALSE)(6),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)  scales::show_col(     ios_gray_dark_pal(accessible = TRUE)(6),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)

title: macOS Color Palettes — macos_light_pal
text: Set color palettes based macOS System Colors. General information palette can found colors vignette.

title: macOS Color Palettes — macos_light_pal
code: macos_light_pal(order = "contrast", accessible = FALSE, vibrant = FALSE)  macos_dark_pal(order = "contrast", accessible = FALSE, vibrant = FALSE)

text: order Indicates order colors palette accessible Returns accessible alternative colors vibrant Returns vibrant alternative colors

vibrant = TRUE)(11),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)   library(scales) scales::show_col(     macos_dark_pal(order = "default", accessible = FALSE)(11),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)  scales::show_col(     macos_dark_pal(order = "default", accessible = FALSE,     vibrant = TRUE)(11),     borders = NA, labels = FALSE)  scales::show_col(     macos_dark_pal(order = "default", title: iOS Dark Color Scales — scale_colour_ios_dark
text: scales meant used dark themes, e.g, theme_sf_dark(). can used light themes, general, recommend pairing scale_colour_*_darks dark themes better clarity contrast. Note iOS color palettes provide total 9 colors, recommend using 6 groups. last three colors often collide colors palette may affect clarity visualization.

title: iOS Dark Color Scales — scale_colour_ios_dark
code: scale_colour_ios_dark(order = "contrast", accessible = FALSE, ...)  scale_fill_ios_dark(order = "contrast", accessible = FALSE, ...)

title: iOS Dark Color Scales — scale_colour_ios_dark
text: order Indicates order colors palette accessible Indicates whether accessible set colors used ... Arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale aesthetics names aesthetics scale works . scale_name name scale used error messages associated scale. palette palette function called single integer argument (number levels scale) returns values take (e.g., scales::hue_pal()). name name scale. Used axis legend title. waiver(), default, name scale taken first mapping used aesthetic. NULL, legend title omitted. breaks One : NULL breaks waiver() default breaks (scale limits) character vector breaks function takes limits input returns breaks output labels One : NULL labels waiver() default labels computed transformation object character vector giving labels (must length breaks) function takes breaks input returns labels output limits One : NULL use default scale values character vector defines possible values scale order function accepts existing (automatic) values returns new ones na.translate Unlike continuous scales, discrete scales can easily show missing values, default. want remove missing values discrete scale, specify na.translate = FALSE. na.value na.translate = TRUE, aesthetic value missing values displayed ? apply position scales NA always placed far right. drop unused factor levels omitted scale? default, TRUE, uses levels appear data; FALSE uses levels factor. guide function used create guide name. See guides() information. super super class use constructed scale

title: iOS Dark Color Scales — scale_colour_ios_dark
code: if (FALSE) {  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(y = mpg, x = as.factor(cyl))) +   geom_boxplot(aes(color = as.factor(cyl), fill = as.factor(cyl))) +   labs(x = "Miles Per Gallon", y = "MPG",         fill = "Number of Cylinders",        color = "Number of Cylinders",        title = "Fuel Economy",        subtitle = "Fuel economy declines as engines gets bigger",        caption = "Data from the 1974 Motor Trend US magazine.") +   theme_sf_dark() +   scale_fill_ios_dark() +   scale_colour_ios_dark() }

title: macOS Dark Color Scales — scale_colour_macos_dark
code: if (FALSE) {  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(y = mpg, x = as.factor(cyl))) +   geom_boxplot(aes(color = as.factor(cyl), fill = as.factor(cyl))) +   labs(x = "Miles Per Gallon", y = "MPG",         fill = "Number of Cylinders",        color = "Number of Cylinders",        title = "Fuel Economy",        subtitle = "Fuel economy declines as engines gets bigger",        caption = "Data from the 1974 Motor Trend US magazine.") +   theme_sf_dark() +   scale_fill_macos_dark() +   scale_colour_macos_dark() }

title: macOS Light Color Scales — scale_colour_macos_light
text: scales meant used light themes, e.g, theme_sf_light(). can used dark themes, general, recommend pairing scale_colour_*_lights light themes better clarity contrast. Notes macOS color palettes provide total 11 colors, recommend using 8 groups. last three colors often collide colors palette may affect clarity visualization. See macOS colors details raw colors.

title: macOS Light Color Scales — scale_colour_macos_light

title: watchOS Dark Color Scales — scale_colour_watchos_dark
text: watchOS colors bright necessary lot contrast. strictly recommend pair dark themes, e.g., `theme_sf_dark()`. **Notes** - *watchOS color palettes provide total 10 colors, recommend using 7 groups. last three colors often collide colors palette may affect clarity visualization.* - See [watchOS colors](watchos_colour_palettes.html) details raw colors.

title: Set Fonts — sf_set_inter
text: functions can used change font text elements themes. Additionally, font weights (faces) given theme set appropriately ensure readability, e.g., setting title font bold.

title: Set Fonts — sf_set_inter
code: sf_set_inter(ret)  sf_set_sf_pro(ret)  sf_set_custom_font(ret, font_family_name)

title: Set Fonts — sf_set_inter
text: ret ggplot2::theme() object font_family_name name font

title: Set Fonts — sf_set_inter
text: Due limitation extrafont format SF Pro, sf_set_sf_pro() yet available, SF Pro work expected.

title: Set Fonts — sf_set_inter
code: if (FALSE) {    library(ggplot2)    ggplot(mtcars) +    geom_point(aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = factor(gear))) +    labs(title = "Fuel Economy",         subtitle = "Fuel economy declines as weight increases, 1973-74",         caption = "Data from the 1974 Motor Trend US magazine.",         x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",         y = "MPG",         colour = "Gears") +    facet_grid(vs ~ am) +    sf_set_inter(theme_linedraw()) +    scale_colour_ios_light()  } if (FALSE) { library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars) +  geom_point(aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = factor(gear))) +  labs(title = "Fuel Economy",       subtitle = "Fuel economy declines as weight increases, 1973-74",       caption = "Data from the 1974 Motor Trend US magazine.",       x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",       y = "MPG",       colour = "Gears") +  facet_grid(vs ~ am) +  sf_set_custom_font(theme_linedraw(), "Gill Sans") +  scale_colour_ios_light() }

title: San Francisco Themes — sfthemes
text: Accessible Set Themes Color Palettes Optimized Light/Dark Appearances, Different Screen Sizes

title: San Francisco Themes — sfthemes
text: sfthemes pair ggplot2 themes, theme_sf_light(), theme_sf_dark(), collection color scales based Apple's Human Interface Guidelines. Themes inspired occasional appearances charts used Apple within different contexts, e.g., Apple Health app, Screen Time iOS macOS. colors adapted iOS, macOS, watchOS system colors. color scale light dark variant well compliments light/dark themes, scale_colour_ios_light() scale_colour_ios_dark(), respectively. addition, sfthemes uses dynamic type sizing order provide consistent elegant overall resizing re-scaling plot elements. Read . combined, sfthemes offers unique opportunity generate two version plot two similar yet individually optimized color palettes light dark themes.

title: San Francisco Themes — sfthemes
text: Amir Masoud Abdol (@amirmasoudabdol.name)

title: San Francisco Dark Theme — theme_sf_dark
text: minimal theme dark background inspired — adapted — occasional appearances charts used Apple within different contexts, e.g., Apple Health app, Screen Time iOS macOS.

title: San Francisco Dark Theme — theme_sf_dark
code: theme_sf_dark(   font_family = "Inter",   grid = TRUE,   axis = TRUE,   ticks = TRUE,   size_class = NULL,   font_size_class = "xSmall",   element_size_class = "xSmall",   offset_x_ticks = FALSE,   offset_y_ticks = FALSE )

title: San Francisco Dark Theme — theme_sf_dark
text: font_family Primary font family plot grid Panel grid (TRUE, FALSE, combination X, x, Y, y) axis Add x y axes? TRUE, FALSE, "xy" ticks Ticks TRUE add ticks size_class Resizes texts elements based one given size classes: character "xSmall", "Small", "Medium", "Large", "xLarge", "xxLarge", "xxxLarge" font_size_class resizes text based one size classes element_size_class resizes elements based one size classes offset_x_ticks Fancier x tick labels [Experimental] offset_y_ticks Fancier y tick labels [Experimental]

title: San Francisco Dark Theme — theme_sf_dark
text: Recommended color fill scales used : scale_colour_ios_dark scale_fill_ios_dark scale_colour_macos_dark scale_fill_macos_dark scale_colour_watchos_dark scale_fill_watchos_dark

title: San Francisco Dark Theme — theme_sf_dark
code: if (FALSE) { library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy, colour = class)) +   geom_point() +   labs(x = "Displacement", y ="MPG",        color = "Type of Car",        title = "Fuel Economy",        subtitle = "Fuel economy declines as engines get bigger",        caption = "Fuel economy data from 1999 to 2008.") +   theme_sf_dark() +   scale_colour_ios_dark() }

text: minimal theme light background inspired — adapted — occasional appearances charts used Apple within different contexts, e.g., Apple Health app, Screen Time iOS macOS.

text: font_family Primary font family plot grid Panel grid (TRUE, FALSE, combination X, x, Y, y) axis Add x y axes? TRUE, FALSE, "xy" ticks Ticks TRUE add ticks size_class Resizes texts elements based one given size classes: character "xSmall", "Small", "Medium", "Large", "xLarge", "xxLarge", "xxxLarge" font_size_class resizes text based one size classes element_size_class resizes elements based one size classes offset_x_ticks Fancier x tick labels [Experimental] offset_y_ticks Fancier y tick labels [Experimental]

text: Recommended color fill scales used : scale_colour_ios_light scale_fill_ios_light scale_colour_macos_light scale_fill_macos_light

code: if (FALSE) { library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy, colour = class)) +   geom_point() +   labs(x = "Displacement", y ="MPG",        color = "Type of Car",        title = "Fuel Economy",        subtitle = "Fuel economy declines as engines get bigger",        caption = "Fuel economy data from 1999 to 2008.") +   theme_sf_light() +   scale_colour_ios_light() }

title: watchOS Color Palette — watchos_dark_pal
text: Set color palettes based watchOS System Colors. General information palette can found colors vignette.

title: watchOS Color Palette — watchos_dark_pal
code: watchos_dark_pal(order = "contrast")

title: watchOS Color Palette — watchos_dark_pal
text: order Indicates order colors palette

title: watchOS Color Palette — watchos_dark_pal
text: functions ideal accessing raw color values, can used within functions raw color values needed, e.g., plot. order use ggplot functions, must utilize one followings: scale_colour_watchos_dark Note recommend paining palette dark themes, high base brightness colors may make hard distinguish light themes

title: watchOS Color Palette — watchos_dark_pal
code: library(scales)   scales::show_col(watchos_dark_pal(order = "default")(10),                   borders = NA, labels = FALSE)   scales::show_col(watchos_dark_pal(order = "contrast")(10),                   borders = NA, labels = FALSE)

title: sfthemes 0.2.0
text: new function, sf_set_custom_font(), can used apply custom font elements fonts ggplot2::themes() Inter Light Extra Bold now included package

title: sfthemes 0.2.0
text: themes now accepting fewer parameters, therefore easier use. Note fonts look great sfthemes, minor glitches expected custom fonts. Make sure inspect theme custom font publishing . font_size_scale → font_size_class element_size_scale → element_size_class

title: sfthemes 0.2.0
text: sf_set_inter() now working, can used change theme’s font family well

title: sfthemes 0.1.0
text: initial release sfthemes package. version offers two main themes, theme_sf_light() theme_sf_dark() alongside 9 different color palettes, offering complementary accessible variant. Inter set default typeface package resolve issues around full integration SF Pro.

title: sfthemes 0.1.0
text: sf_set_sf_pro() sf_set_inter() working intended SF Pro set correctly due extrafont importing .ttf files, therefore, missing weights.
